content: Anyone else have issues spinning up Backdrop on Pantheon? https://backdropcms.org/try-backdrop

I've created an issue. https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdrop-pantheon/issues/38. Pantheon support thinks it's the lack of a pantheon.upstream.yml but they can't provide official support so that's all the help we'll get

Error deploying Backdrop site on Pantheon: add pantheon.upstream.yml. 路 Issue #38 路 backdrop-ops/backdrop-pantheon
Pantheon support suggested we try add https://github.com/pantheon-systems/drops-7/blob/default/pantheon.upstream.yml and see if that works. I think we should have that file anyway even if it doesn&...

Something is wrong with the git repo https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdrop-pantheon @jenlampton @quicksketch The "main" branch last had a commit two years ago. I only found this out when trying to spin up a site and it failed. My fork has a pantheon.upstream.yml but not in the parent. Something got lost

backdrop-ops/backdrop-pantheon
Version of Backdrop CMS that runs on the Pantheon hosting platform. - backdrop-ops/backdrop-pantheon
@Herb ohnoes, this is definitely my fault... looking into it now
@Herb what's the last commit in your fork?
@quicksketch who did the 1.16.2 update this wednesday? We may need them to push that code back up to the master branch

@Herb @quicksketch fixed everything... I have no idea how that happened -- but I'm 100% sure it was my fault. Maybe there was already a main branch on that repo? maybe I got my remotes crossed? no idea... I'm so sorry everyone!
@jenlampton thanks for fixing! This stuff happens, I know I've done similar. I'll be able to check tomorrow
